intro: Alonsoa urticifolia, commonly known as the stinging nettle plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves that can cause skin irritation upon contact. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Alonsoa urticifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can grow in a variety of habitats, including forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it a common weed in certain regions, though it also has traditional uses in some cultures.
